intro: Arracacia pringlei, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, red berries that are a food source for various wildlife species. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of soil types. Due to its ornamental value, it has been introduced to other parts of the world, sometimes becoming invasive.
